briefTitle: Pharmacodynamic Evaluation of PL2200 Versus Enteric-Coated Aspirin in Diabetic Patients

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Non-Insulin-Dependent Diabetes Mellitus
* Adults 21 to 79 years, inclusive
* Body mass index between 30 and 40 kg/m2, inclusive

Exclusion Criteria:

* Currently prescribed aspirin or anti-coagulants
* Contraindications to aspirin
* Significant disease history or active disease other than Non-Insulin-Dependent Diabetes Mellitus
* Patient requires insulin

outcomeMeasures.title: Time to 99% Inhibition of Serum Thromboxane
outcomeMeasures.description: Serial measurements of aspirin anti-platelet activity will be collected over 11 days, and compared between groups, to allow a determination of pharmacodynamic (anti-platelet) bioequivalence between study drugs. Aspirin's antiplatelet activity is measured by the capacity of platelets to generate serum thromboxane (a surrogate marker for inhibition of COX-1 by aspirin). Inhibition of serum thromboxane is a key marker of antiplatelet efficacy.
